summary: The Autism Family Caregivers Act of 2025 authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to eligible entities for providing evidence-based caregiver skills training to family caregivers of children with autism spectrum disorder or other developmental disabilities. The program aims to improve the well-being of children and caregivers, teach intervention strategies, and promote greater inclusion in family and community life. The bill outlines application requirements, emphasizes reducing disparities, specifies fund usage, and mandates stakeholder implementation committees. It also includes reporting requirements and authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030.
